thread.title: Portland Timbers beat Real Salt Lake, 1-0: Live recap
thread.title_full: Portland Timbers beat Real Salt Lake, 1-0: Live recap | OregonLive.com

author: Molly Blue | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Portland Timbers beat Real Salt Lake, 1-0: Live recap
text:
The Portland Timbers have defeated Real Salt Lake 1-0 after a converted penalty kick by Fanendo Adi in the 54th minute in Utah. RSL were down to 10 men after Olave was sent off for a challenge on Lucas Melano which led to the penalty.
Timbers coach Caleb Porter unveiled an offense-first lineup tonight that paid off in every way but scoring in the first half as Portland hammered RSL with seven shots. Their 4-3-3 lineup for this game is original, with Diego Chara as the single defensive midfielder and an attack with Adi, Lucas Melano , Rodney Wallace , Diego Valeri and Darlington Nagbe .
Do you think the move paid off? Tell us what you think. Recap our live updates in the comments section below and then chime in with your thoughts on the Timbers as they continue to chase a postseason berth.
-- Molly Blue
mblue@oregonian.com
@mollyablue
